response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("age", "medium", "Younger individuals, particularly males, tend to have higher recidivism rates."),
    ("gender", "high", "Males generally have a higher likelihood of reoffending compared to females."),
    ("race", "medium", "Certain racial groups may experience systemic issues that can contribute to higher recidivism rates."),
    ("number_of_arrests", "high", "Having multiple arrests is a strong indicator of potential future criminal behavior."),
    ("convictions", "high", "Previous convictions significantly increase the likelihood of reoffending."),
    ("marital_status", "medium", "Being unmarried can correlate with higher recidivism due to lack of social support."),
    ("living_situation", "medium", "Not living alone may provide some support, but the quality of the environment matters."),
    ("education", "medium", "A high school diploma is a positive factor, but lack of higher education can limit opportunities."),
    ("employment_history", "medium", "Holding only one job in the past year suggests instability, which can increase risk."),
    ("substance_use", "low", "Not using drugs in the past four years is a positive factor that reduces risk."),
    ("mental_health", "high", "Feeling persistently down can indicate underlying mental health issues that may contribute to recidivism."),
    ("family_background", "medium", "Growing up in a single-parent household can be a risk factor, but context matters."),
    ("urban_environment", "medium", "Living in an urban area can expose individuals to higher crime rates and negative influences."),
    ("spiritual_beliefs", "low", "Belief in a higher power may provide some psychological support, potentially reducing risk.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Younger individuals, particularly males, tend to have higher recidivism rates.
Males generally have a higher likelihood of reoffending compared to females.
Certain racial groups may experience systemic issues that can contribute to higher recidivism rates.
Having multiple arrests is a strong indicator of potential future criminal behavior.
Previous convictions significantly increase the likelihood of reoffending.
Being unmarried can correlate with higher recidivism due to lack of social support.
Not living alone may provide some support, but the quality of the environment matters.
A high school diploma is a positive factor, but lack of higher education can limit opportunities.
Holding only one job in the past year suggests instability, which can increase risk.
Not using drugs in the past four years is a positive factor that reduces risk.
Feeling persistently down can indicate underlying mental health issues that may contribute to recidivism.
Growing up in a single-parent household can be a risk factor, but context matters.
Living in an urban area can expose individuals to higher crime rates and negative influences.
Belief in a higher power may provide some psychological support, potentially reducing risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 4 inches and weighs 152 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and all of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 2, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
